     30 +    207 +## Recent Fixes (Latest Session)
     31 +    208 +
     32 +    209 +### Theme Dropdown Sync Fix ‚úÖ
     33 +    210 +
     34 +    211 +**Problem:** Theme dropdown showing "Default Light" even when sunset-dark theme was loaded from LocalStorage.
     35 +    212 +
     36 +    213 +**Root Cause:** Race condition in theme loading - dropdown was being set BEFORE async theme load completed.
     37 +    214 +
     38 +    215 +**Solution:**
     39 +    216 +
     40 +    217 +```javascript
     41 +    218 +// OLD (buggy):
     42 +    219 +if (savedTheme) {
     43 +    220 +  themeSelector.value = savedTheme; // Sets immediately
     44 +    221 +  themeManager.loadTheme(savedTheme); // Async, not awaited
     45 +    222 +}
     46 +    223 +
     47 +    224 +// NEW (fixed):
     48 +    225 +if (savedTheme) {
     49 +    226 +  themeManager
     50 +    227 +    .loadTheme(savedTheme)
     51 +    228 +    .then(() => {
     52 +    229 +      themeSelector.value = savedTheme; // Only after successful load
     53 +    230 +      console.log(`‚úÖ Theme restored: ${savedTheme}`);
     54 +    231 +    })
     55 +    232 +    .catch(err => {
     56 +    233 +      // Fallback with proper sync
     57 +    234 +      themeManager.loadTheme('default-light').then(() => {
     58 +    235 +        themeSelector.value = 'default-light';
     59 +    236 +      });
     60 +    237 +    });
     61 +    238 +}
     62 +    239 +```
     63 +    240 +
     64 +    241 +**Key Changes:**
     65 +    242 +
     66 +    243 +1. Await theme load completion before syncing dropdown
     67 +    244 +2. Added success callback for dropdown update
     68 +    245 +3. Added error handling with fallback
     69 +    246 +4. Added console logging for debugging
     70 +    247 +
     71 +    248 +**Results:**
     72 +    249 +
     73 +    250 +- ‚úÖ Dropdown now syncs correctly with all themes
     74 +    251 +- ‚úÖ No more race conditions
     75 +    252 +- ‚úÖ Proper error handling
     76 +    253 +- ‚úÖ Works for all 12 themes (6 theme families √ó 2 variants)
     77 +    254 +
     78 +    255 +**Files Modified:** `script.js` (lines 1167-1183)
     79 +206 256

### ‚ú® `docs/02-architecture/mermaid-theme-architecture.md` **[ADDED]**

**Status:** ‚úÖ **NEW FILE** - This file has been newly created

**Type:** Documentation üìñ

```diff
@@ -0,0 +1,208 @@
      1 +# Mermaid Theme Architecture - Comprehensive Reference
      2 +
      3 +**Last Updated:** 12/7/2025
      4 +**Source:** Official Mermaid.js theming documentation
      5 +
      6 +## Complete Mermaid Theme Variables
      7 +
      8 +### Core Global Variables
      9 +
     10 +| Variable     | Type       | Description                  | Default                        |
     11 +| ------------ | ---------- | ---------------------------- | ------------------------------ |
     12 +| `background` | Background | Page background              | `#f4f4f4`                      |
     13 +| `fontFamily` | Text       | Font family                  | `trebuchet ms, verdana, arial` |
     14 +| `fontSize`   | Text       | Font size                    | `16px`                         |
     15 +| `darkMode`   | Boolean    | Affects color calculations   | `false`                        |
     16 +| `textColor`  | Text       | General text over background | calculated                     |
     17 +| `lineColor`  | Line       | Lines and connections        | calculated                     |
     18 +| `mainBkg`    | Background | Main background for objects  | calculated                     |
     19 +
     20 +### Primary/Secondary/Tertiary Color Sets
     21 +
     22 +Each set has 3 variables (background, text, border):
     23 +
     24 +| Variable               | Type       | Description                |
     25 +| ---------------------- | ---------- | -------------------------- |
     26 +| `primaryColor`         | Background | Primary node background    |
     27 +| `primaryTextColor`     | Text       | Text in primary nodes      |
     28 +| `primaryBorderColor`   | Border     | Border for primary nodes   |
     29 +| `secondaryColor`       | Background | Secondary node background  |
     30 +| `secondaryTextColor`   | Text       | Text in secondary nodes    |
     31 +| `secondaryBorderColor` | Border     | Border for secondary nodes |
     32 +| `tertiaryColor`        | Background | Tertiary node background   |
     33 +| `tertiaryTextColor`    | Text       | Text in tertiary nodes     |
     34 +| `tertiaryBorderColor`  | Border     | Border for tertiary nodes  |
     35 +
     36 +### Flowchart-Specific Variables
     37 +
     38 +| Variable              | Type       | Description           |
     39 +| --------------------- | ---------- | --------------------- |
     40 +| `nodeBorder`          | Border     | Node border color     |
     41 +| `clusterBkg`          | Background | Subgraph background   |
     42 +| `clusterBorder`       | Border     | Subgraph border       |
     43 +| `defaultLinkColor`    | Line       | Link/edge color       |
     44 +| `titleColor`          | Text       | Title text color      |
     45 +| `edgeLabelBackground` | Background | Edge label background |
     46 +| `nodeTextColor`       | Text       | Text inside nodes     |
     47 +
     48 +### Sequence Diagram Variables
     49 +
     50 +| Variable                | Type       | Description           |
     51 +| ----------------------- | ---------- | --------------------- |
     52 +| `actorBkg`              | Background | Actor box background  |
     53 +| `actorBorder`           | Border     | Actor box border      |
     54 +| `actorTextColor`        | Text       | Actor text            |
     55 +| `actorLineColor`        | Line       | Actor lifeline        |
     56 +| `signalColor`           | Line       | Signal arrows         |
     57 +| `signalTextColor`       | Text       | Signal labels         |
     58 +| `labelBoxBkgColor`      | Background | Label box background  |
     59 +| `labelBoxBorderColor`   | Border     | Label box border      |
     60 +| `labelTextColor`        | Text       | Label text            |
     61 +| `loopTextColor`         | Text       | Loop text             |
     62 +| `activationBorderColor` | Border     | Activation border     |
     63 +| `activationBkgColor`    | Background | Activation background |
     64 +| `sequenceNumberColor`   | Text       | Sequence numbers      |
     65 +
     66 +### Pie Chart Variables
     67 +
     68 +| Variable              | Type       | Description                           |
     69 +| --------------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------- |
     70 +| `pie1` - `pie12`      | Background | Fill colors for sections              |
     71 +| `pieTitleTextSize`    | Text       | Title font size (default: `25px`)     |
     72 +| `pieTitleTextColor`   | Text       | Title text color                      |
     73 +| `pieSectionTextSize`  | Text       | Section label size (default: `17px`)  |
     74 +| `pieSectionTextColor` | Text       | **Section label color (ON SLICES!)**  |
     75 +| `pieLegendTextSize`   | Text       | Legend font size (default: `17px`)    |
     76 +| `pieLegendTextColor`  | Text       | Legend text color                     |
     77 +| `pieStrokeColor`      | Border     | Slice borders (default: `black`)      |
     78 +| `pieStrokeWidth`      | Border     | Slice border width (default: `2px`)   |
     79 +| `pieOuterStrokeWidth` | Border     | Outer circle width (default: `2px`)   |
     80 +| `pieOuterStrokeColor` | Border     | Outer circle color (default: `black`) |
     81 +| `pieOpacity`          | Visual     | Slice opacity (default: `0.7`)        |
     82 +
     83 +### State Diagram Variables
     84 +
     85 +| Variable        | Type       | Description                |
     86 +| --------------- | ---------- | -------------------------- |
     87 +| `labelColor`    | Text       | State label color          |
     88 +| `altBackground` | Background | Composite state background |
     89 +
     90 +### Class Diagram Variables
     91 +
     92 +| Variable    | Type | Description      |
     93 +| ----------- | ---- | ---------------- |
     94 +| `classText` | Text | Class text color |
     95 +
     96 +### User Journey Variables
     97 +
     98 +| Variable                  | Type       | Description   |
     99 +| ------------------------- | ---------- | ------------- |
    100 +| `fillType0` - `fillType7` | Background | Section fills |
    101 +
    102 +## Critical Insights
    103 +
    104 +### 1. Pie Section Text Contrast Issue
    105 +
    106 +**Problem:** `pieSectionTextColor` is text **ON** the colored pie slices!
    107 +
    108 +- If slices are dark and text is dark ‚Üí **UNREADABLE**
    109 +- If slices are light and text is light ‚Üí **UNREADABLE**
    110 +
    111 +**Solution:** `pieSectionTextColor` must contrast with `pie1-pie12` colors!
    112 +
    113 +### 2. Background vs Text Variables
    114 +
    115 +- **Background variables** (end with `Bkg`, `Color`, or are named `pie1-12`)
    116 +- **Text variables** (contain `Text` or `textColor`)
    117 +- **Border variables** (contain `Border` or `Stroke`)
    118 +- **Line variables** (contain `Line` or `lineColor`)
    119 +
    120 +### 3. Calculated vs Explicit
    121 +
    122 +- Mermaid **calculates** many colors if not provided
    123 +- But calculation may not match our theme aesthetics
    124 +- **We should set ALL critical variables explicitly**
    125 +
    126 +## Implementation Strategy
    127 +
    128 +### For Each Theme, Define
    129 +
    130 +1. **Core Backgrounds** (3 levels for hierarchy)
    131 +   - `primaryColor`, `secondaryColor`, `tertiaryColor`
    132 +
    133 +2. **All Text Colors** (must contrast with their backgrounds!)
    134 +   - `primaryTextColor`, `secondaryTextColor`, `tertiaryTextColor`
    135 +   - `nodeTextColor`, `actorTextColor`, `signalTextColor`
    136 +   - `pieTitleTextColor`, `pieSectionTextColor`, `pieLegendTextColor`
    137 +
    138 +3. **All Border Colors** (visible against backgrounds)
    139 +   - `primaryBorderColor`, `secondaryBorderColor`, `tertiaryBorderColor`
    140 +   - `nodeBorder`, `actorBorder`, `clusterBorder`
    141 +   - `pieStrokeColor`, `pieOuterStrokeColor`
    142 +
    143 +4. **Line/Connection Colors**
    144 +   - `lineColor`, `defaultLinkColor`
    145 +   - `signalColor`, `actorLineColor`
    146 +
    147 +5. **Pie Slice Backgrounds** (12 distinct colors)
    148 +   - `pie1` through `pie12` - must be DISTINCT from text color!
    149 +
    150 +## Architecture Pattern
    151 +
    152 +```javascript
    153 +mermaid.initialize({
    154 +  theme: 'base',
    155 +  themeVariables: {
    156 +    // Core (affects ALL diagrams)
    157 +    background: bgPrimary,
    158 +    fontFamily: '...',
    159 +    fontSize: '16px',
    160 +
    161 +    // Primary set (most nodes)
    162 +    primaryColor: [BACKGROUND],
    163 +    primaryTextColor: [TEXT - must contrast!],
    164 +    primaryBorderColor: [BORDER - visible],
    165 +
    166 +    // Secondary set (clusters, special nodes)
    167 +    secondaryColor: [BACKGROUND],
    168 +    secondaryTextColor: [TEXT - must contrast!],
    169 +    secondaryBorderColor: [BORDER - visible],
    170 +
    171 +    // Tertiary set (nested elements)
    172 +    tertiaryColor: [BACKGROUND],
    173 +    tertiaryTextColor: [TEXT - must contrast!],
    174 +    tertiaryBorderColor: [BORDER - visible],
    175 +
    176 +    // Flowchart specific
    177 +    nodeBorder: [VISIBLE],
    178 +    nodeTextColor: [CONTRASTING],
    179 +    edgeLabelBackground: [BACKGROUND],
    180 +
    181 +    // Sequence diagram specific
    182 +    actorBkg: [BACKGROUND],
    183 +    actorTextColor: [CONTRASTING],
    184 +
    185 +    // Pie chart specific
    186 +    pie1-12: [12 DISTINCT COLORS],
    187 +    pieSectionTextColor: [CONTRASTS WITH pie1-12!],
    188 +
    189 +    // Lines
    190 +    lineColor: [VISIBLE],
    191 +    signalColor: [VISIBLE],
    192 +  }
    193 +});
    194 +```
    195 +
    196 +## Testing Checklist
    197 +
    198 +- [ ] Flowchart - nodes, clusters, edges readable
    199 +- [ ] Sequence diagram - actors, signals, loops readable
    200 +- [ ] Pie chart - slices, percentages, legend readable
    201 +- [ ] State diagram - states, transitions readable
    202 +- [ ] Class diagram - classes, methods readable
    203 +- [ ] User journey - tasks, emotions readable
    204 +
    205 +## References
    206 +
    207 +- [Mermaid Theming Documentation](https://mermaid.js.org/config/theming.html)
    208 +- [Base Theme Source](https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid/blob/develop/packages/mermaid/src/themes/theme-base.js)
    209  

```

```diff
@@ -0,0 +1,226 @@
      1 +# Prism Token Architecture - Comprehensive Reference
      2 +
      3 +**Last Updated:** 12/7/2025
      4 +**Source:** Official Prism.js documentation + One Dark theme analysis
      5 +
      6 +## Standard Token Classes
      7 +
      8 +### Core Language Constructs
      9 +
     10 +| Token Class   | Purpose                    | Example                                  | Recommended Color Hue             |
     11 +| ------------- | -------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | --------------------------------- |
     12 +| `keyword`     | Reserved words             | `if`, `else`, `class`, `final`, `sealed` | Purple/Magenta (286¬∞)             |
     13 +| `builtin`     | Built-in functions/types   | `String`, `Array`, `Console`             | Green (95¬∞)                       |
     14 +| `class-name`  | Class/Interface/Type names | `Rectangle`, `Shape`, `Person`           | Orange (29¬∞)                      |
     15 +| `function`    | Function/method names      | `main`, `println`, `forEach`             | Blue (207¬∞)                       |
     16 +| `boolean`     | True/false values          | `true`, `false`                          | Orange (29¬∞)                      |
     17 +| `number`      | Numeric literals           | `42`, `3.14`, `0xDEADBEEF`               | Orange (29¬∞)                      |
     18 +| `string`      | String literals            | `"Hello"`, `'World'`                     | Green (95¬∞)                       |
     19 +| `char`        | Character literals         | `'A'`, `'\n'`                            | Green (95¬∞)                       |
     20 +| `symbol`      | Symbols (Smalltalk, Ruby)  | `:mySymbol`                              | Green (95¬∞)                       |
     21 +| `regex`       | Regular expressions        | `/[a-z]+/i`                              | Green (95¬∞)                       |
     22 +| `operator`    | Operators                  | `+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, `=`, `==`            | Purple (286¬∞)                     |
     23 +| `variable`    | Variable names (special)   | Less/Bash variables                      | Blue (207¬∞)                       |
     24 +| `constant`    | Constants                  | `PI`, `MAX_SIZE`, `stdout`               | Orange (29¬∞)                      |
     25 +| `property`    | Object properties          | CSS properties, JSON keys                | Red (355¬∞)                        |
     26 +| `punctuation` | Delimiters                 | `{`, `}`, `;`, `,`                       | Gray/White                        |
     27 +| `comment`     | Code comments              | `// comment`, `/* block */`              | Muted gray (220¬∞, low saturation) |
     28 +
     29 +### Markup-Specific Tokens
     30 +
     31 +| Token Class  | Purpose             | Example                     |
     32 +| ------------ | ------------------- | --------------------------- |
     33 +| `tag`        | HTML/XML tags       | `<div>`, `<p>`              |
     34 +| `attr-name`  | Attribute names     | `id`, `class`, `href`       |
     35 +| `attr-value` | Attribute values    | `"header"`, `"https://..."` |
     36 +| `namespace`  | XML namespaces      | `html:p`, `foo:bar`         |
     37 +| `prolog`     | XML prolog          | `<?xml version="1.0"?>`     |
     38 +| `doctype`    | DOCTYPE declaration | `<!DOCTYPE html>`           |
     39 +| `cdata`      | CDATA sections      | `<![CDATA[...]]>`           |
     40 +| `entity`     | HTML entities       | `&amp;`, `&#x2665;`         |
     41 +
     42 +### Document Markup Tokens
     43 +
     44 +| Token Class | Purpose         | Example      |
     45 +| ----------- | --------------- | ------------ |
     46 +| `bold`      | Bold text       | `**bold**`   |
     47 +| `italic`    | Italic text     | `*italic*`   |
     48 +| `important` | Important (CSS) | `!important` |
     49 +
     50 +### Stylesheet Tokens
     51 +
     52 +| Token Class | Purpose       | Example                  |
     53 +| ----------- | ------------- | ------------------------ |
     54 +| `atrule`    | CSS @ rules   | `@media`, `@import`      |
     55 +| `selector`  | CSS selectors | `.class`, `#id`, `div p` |
     56 +| `url`       | URLs          | `url(image.png)`         |
     57 +
     58 +### Diff Tokens
     59 +
     60 +| Token Class | Purpose       |
     61 +| ----------- | ------------- |
     62 +| `inserted`  | Added lines   |
     63 +| `deleted`   | Removed lines |
     64 +
     65 +## Professional Theme Analysis (One Dark)
     66 +
     67 +### Color Grouping Strategy
     68 +
     69 +One Dark uses **7 core hues** systematically:
     70 +
     71 +1. **mono-1** (220¬∞, 14%, 71%) - Default text
     72 +2. **mono-2** (220¬∞, 9%, 55%) - Secondary text
     73 +3. **mono-3** (220¬∞, 10%, 40%) - Comments
     74 +4. **hue-1** (187¬∞, 47%, 55%) - Cyan - URLs
     75 +5. **hue-2** (207¬∞, 82%, 66%) - Blue - Variables, operators, functions
     76 +6. **hue-3** (286¬∞, 60%, 67%) - Purple - Keywords
     77 +7. **hue-4** (95¬∞, 38%, 62%) - Green - Strings
     78 +8. **hue-5** (355¬∞, 65%, 65%) - Red - Properties, tags, symbols
     79 +9. **hue-6** (29¬∞, 54%, 61%) - Orange - Class names, constants, numbers
     80 +
     81 +### Token Grouping
     82 +
     83 +```css
     84 +/* Group 1: Comments */
     85 +.token.comment, .token.prolog, .token.cdata
     86 +
     87 +/* Group 2: Neutral (inherit default color) */
     88 +.token.doctype, .token.punctuation, .token.entity
     89 +
     90 +/* Group 3: Orange - Class names, constants, numbers */
     91 +.token.attr-name, .token.class-name, .token.boolean,
     92 +.token.constant, .token.number, .token.atrule
     93 +
     94 +/* Group 4: Purple - Keywords */
     95 +.token.keyword
     96 +
     97 +/* Group 5: Red - Properties, tags */
     98 +.token.property, .token.tag, .token.symbol,
     99 +.token.deleted, .token.important
    100 +
    101 +/* Group 6: Green - Strings, builtins */
    102 +.token.selector, .token.string, .token.char,
    103 +.token.builtin, .token.inserted, .token.regex,
    104 +.token.attr-value
    105 +
    106 +/* Group 7: Blue - Variables, operators, functions */
    107 +.token.variable, .token.operator, .token.function
    108 +
    109 +/* Group 8: Cyan - URLs */
    110 +.token.url
    111 +```
    112 +
    113 +### Language-Specific Overrides
    114 +
    115 +Professional themes use **cascading specificity** for language-specific rules:
    116 +
    117 +```css
    118 +/* JavaScript overrides */
    119 +.language-javascript .token.operator { color: purple; }
    120 +.language-javascript .token.template-string > .token.interpolation { ... }
    121 +
    122 +/* CSS overrides */
    123 +.language-css .token.selector { color: red; }
    124 +.language-css .token.property { color: gray; }
    125 +
    126 +/* JSON overrides */
    127 +.language-json .token.null.keyword { color: orange; }
    128 +
    129 +/* Markdown overrides */
    130 +.language-markdown .token.url { ... }
    131 +```
    132 +
    133 +## Implementation Architecture
    134 +
    135 +### CSS Specificity Levels
    136 +
    137 +1. **Base tokens** - All languages
    138 +2. **Language-specific overrides** - `.language-xxx .token.yyy`
    139 +3. **Nested tokens** - `.token.xxx > .token.yyy`
    140 +4. **Plugin overrides** - `.rainbow-braces`, `.diff-highlight`, etc.
    141 +
    142 +### Variable Mapping Strategy
    143 +
    144 +```css
    145 +/* Map standard Prism tokens to theme CSS variables */
    146 +.token.keyword {
    147 +  color: var(--syntax-keyword);
    148 +}
    149 +.token.string {
    150 +  color: var(--syntax-string);
    151 +}
    152 +.token.class-name {
    153 +  color: var(--syntax-class-name); /* Distinct variable! */
    154 +}
    155 +```
    156 +
    157 +### Token Aliases
    158 +
    159 +Prism uses aliases to group similar tokens:
    160 +
    161 +- `attr-value` can contain nested `punctuation` tokens
    162 +- `template-string` can contain `interpolation` with nested tokens
    163 +- Language definitions use `alias` property to inherit styles
    164 +
    165 +## Best Practices
    166 +
    167 +1. **Use Distinct Variables** - Don't reuse variables across semantically different tokens
    168 +2. **Follow Standards** - Match Prism's standard token names
    169 +3. **Language Overrides** - Use when default grouping doesn't fit
    170 +4. **Test Comprehensively** - Verify with multiple languages (Java, Python, JS, CSS, etc.)
    171 +5. **Font Weight** - Use bold/normal strategically for visual hierarchy
    172 +6. **Color Contrast** - Ensure WCAG AA compliance (4.5:1 for text)
    173 +
    174 +## Token Coverage Checklist
    175 +
    176 +### Must Cover (Core)
    177 +
    178 +- [ ] keyword
    179 +- [ ] builtin
    180 +- [ ] class-name (distinct from keyword!)
    181 +- [ ] function
    182 +- [ ] string
    183 +- [ ] number
    184 +- [ ] boolean
    185 +- [ ] comment
    186 +- [ ] operator
    187 +- [ ] punctuation
    188 +- [ ] variable
    189 +- [ ] property
    190 +- [ ] constant
    191 +- [ ] regex
    192 +
    193 +### Markup Languages
    194 +
    195 +- [ ] tag
    196 +- [ ] attr-name
    197 +- [ ] attr-value
    198 +- [ ] namespace
    199 +- [ ] doctype
    200 +- [ ] entity
    201 +
    202 +### Advanced
    203 +
    204 +- [ ] atrule (CSS)
    205 +- [ ] selector (CSS)
    206 +- [ ] url
    207 +- [ ] inserted/deleted (Diff)
    208 +- [ ] bold/italic (Markdown)
    209 +- [ ] important (CSS)
    210 +
    211 +## Implementation Checklist
    212 +
    213 +- [ ] Define comprehensive CSS variable palette (8-10 distinct hues)
    214 +- [ ] Map ALL standard tokens to variables
    215 +- [ ] Add language-specific overrides where needed
    216 +- [ ] Test with Java (most complex token usage)
    217 +- [ ] Test with Python, JavaScript, CSS
    218 +- [ ] Verify font-weight hierarchy
    219 +- [ ] Check color contrast ratios
    220 +- [ ] Document color semantics
    221 +
    222 +## References
    223 +
    224 +- [Prism Standard Tokens](https://prismjs.com/tokens.html)
    225 +- [Prism Theme: One Dark](https://github.com/PrismJS/prism-themes/blob/master/themes/prism-one-dark.css)
    226 +- [Atom One Dark Colors](https://github.com/atom/atom/tree/master/packages/one-dark-syntax)
    227  

```

### üìÑ `src/js/services/MermaidService.js`

**Type:** JavaScript Source File üü®

```diff
@@ -2,12 +2,51 @@
  2   2   * MermaidService - Mermaid Diagram Rendering Service
  3   3   *
  4   4   * Handles all Mermaid diagram rendering with theme-aware configuration.
      5 + * Automatically detects light/dark themes and adjusts for optimal readability.
  5   6   * Isolated service for better testability and maintainability.
  6   7   */
  7   8  
  8   9  import { MERMAID_CONFIG } from '../config/constants.js';
  9  10  import { getCssVariable } from '../utils/colorHelpers.js';
 10  11  
     12 +/**
     13 + * Calculate relative luminance of a color
     14 + * Used to detect if theme is light or dark
     15 + *
     16 + * @param {string} color - Hex color (#rrggbb)
     17 + * @returns {number} Luminance value (0-1)
     18 + * @private
     19 + */
     20 +function getRelativeLuminance(color) {
     21 +  // Remove # if present
     22 +  const hex = color.replace('#', '');
     23 +
     24 +  // Convert to RGB
     25 +  const r = parseInt(hex.substr(0, 2), 16) / 255;
     26 +  const g = parseInt(hex.substr(2, 2), 16) / 255;
     27 +  const b = parseInt(hex.substr(4, 2), 16) / 255;
     28 +
     29 +  // Apply sRGB gamma correction
     30 +  const rsRGB = r <= 0.03928 ? r / 12.92 : ((r + 0.055) / 1.055) ** 2.4;
     31 +  const gsRGB = g <= 0.03928 ? g / 12.92 : ((g + 0.055) / 1.055) ** 2.4;
     32 +  const bsRGB = b <= 0.03928 ? b / 12.92 : ((b + 0.055) / 1.055) ** 2.4;
     33 +
     34 +  // Calculate relative luminance
     35 +  return 0.2126 * rsRGB + 0.7152 * gsRGB + 0.0722 * bsRGB;
     36 +}
     37 +
     38 +/**
     39 + * Detect if current theme is light or dark
     40 + *
     41 + * @param {string} bgColor - Background color
     42 + * @returns {boolean} True if light theme
     43 + * @private
     44 + */
     45 +function isLightTheme(bgColor) {
     46 +  const luminance = getRelativeLuminance(bgColor);
     47 +  return luminance > 0.5; // Threshold for light/dark
